alert.note: Alert for Okanogan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 04 at 2:24PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The Cedar Creek burn scar in Okanogan County in north central Washington. * WHEN...Until 415 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 220 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms on the Cedar Creek burn scar. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wolf Creek, Aspen Lake, and Chickadee trails. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. The heavy rains may trigger rockslides, mudslides, and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
